flounder.networking.packets

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.networking.packets.Packet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PacketDisconnect, PacketLogin

    public abstract class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that can be extended to create packets that are sent between servers and clients.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Packet() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void clientHandlePacket(Client client, java.net.InetAddress address, int port)
      This is run when the client receives the packet.
      abstract byte[] getData()
      Gets the data contained in the packet.
      java.lang.String getDataPrefix()
      Gets the packet class prefix, should be appended to the packets message before getData().
      java.lang.String readData(byte[] data)
      Reads bytes of data to get the packets contents.
      abstract void serverHandlePacket(Server server, java.net.InetAddress address, int port)
      This is run when the server receives the packet.
      abstract void writeData(Client client)
      Writes the data from the client to the server.
      abstract void writeData(Server server)
      Writes the data from the server to all connected clients.

        Writes the data from the client to the server.
        Parameters:
        client - The client to send the data from.

      • writeData

        public abstract void writeData(Server server)
        Writes the data from the server to all connected clients.
        Parameters:
        server - The server to send the data from.

      • readData

        public java.lang.String readData(byte[] data)
        Reads bytes of data to get the packets contents.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to read.
        Returns:
        The message read from the data.

      • clientHandlePacket

        public abstract void clientHandlePacket(Client client,
                                        java.net.InetAddress address,
                                        int port)
        This is run when the client receives the packet.
        Parameters:
        client - The client that is processing the packet.
        address - The address where the data came from.
        port - The port the data came from.

      • serverHandlePacket

        public abstract void serverHandlePacket(Server server,
                                        java.net.InetAddress address,
                                        int port)
        This is run when the server receives the packet.
        Parameters:
        server - The server that is processing the packet.
        address - The address where the data came from.
        port - The port the data came from.

      • getData

        public abstract byte[] getData()
        Gets the data contained in the packet.
        Returns:
        The data contained.

      • getDataPrefix

        public java.lang.String getDataPrefix()
        Gets the packet class prefix, should be appended to the packets message before getData().
        Returns:
        The packets class prefix.
